paragraph.text: Machine learning algorithms enable computers to learn and make intelligent decisions from data without explicit programming. This chapter explores supervised, unsupervised, and reinforcement learning techniques.

supervised.examples: Linear regression, decision trees, neural networks, ensemble methods

unsupervised.use_cases: Customer segmentation, anomaly detection, market basket analysis

reinforcement.description: Learning through trial and error with reward feedback
reinforcement.use_cases: Game playing, robotics, resource allocation, autonomous systems

paragraph.text: The success of machine learning projects depends heavily on feature engineering, model selection, hyperparameter tuning, and proper evaluation metrics. Cross-validation and holdout sets are essential for avoiding overfitting.
